interestingFact: India is the only country where people argue if 'chai' is a drink or an emotion.
Kangaroos outnumber people, but luckily, they can't vote... yet.
In Japan, it’s totally normal for your toilet to have more features than your phone.
Americans measure everything in football fields, except actual football.
Brazilians invented soccer-style dancing long before VAR existed to ruin the fun.
Germans have a word for everything, even a word for the joy of finding a perfect parking spot.
Canada apologizes so often, they’re considering adding it to the national anthem.
Italians believe pizza is an art form, and pineapples are the graffiti ruining it.
In the UK, discussing the weather is a sport, and complaining about it is an art.
South Koreans take karaoke so seriously, they have a backup mic just for high notes.
France is where eating a croissant counts as a cultural experience.
In China, social media influencers include pandas with live-streamed bamboo snacks.
Russia's winters are so cold that even their vodka wears a jacket.
South Africa has 11 official languages, but everyone understands the language of a good braai (BBQ).
Mexico’s tacos are so good, they’ve turned guacamole into a currency.
Egyptians were the original influencers; they made pyramids go viral before Instagram.
In New Zealand, sheep are VIP citizens and outnumber humans by a 5-to-1 ratio.
Argentinians are so passionate about tango, they sometimes dance while waiting in line.
Swedes have mastered the art of fika—taking a coffee break so serious it could be an Olympic sport.
In Norway, midnight sun parties last so long, even the moon feels left out.
